archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang Lomo Saltado with Crispy Oven Potatoes and Jasmine Rice
description: A hot, Korean–Latin stir-fry of sirloin, red onion, tomatoes, and bell peppers in a gochujang–soy–vinegar glaze, served over jasmine rice with a side of crispy oven potatoes and a bright coriander–lime finish.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F; place a sheet pan inside to heat.
Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Slice 700 g sirloin steak into thin strips; pat dry.
Thinly slice 1 red onion; wedge 2 tomatoes; slice 1 bell peppers into strips.
Cut 900 g potatoes into 1 cm fries; pat dry.
Chop 1 small bunch coriander and 2 spring onion; quarter 1 lime.
In a bowl, whisk sauce: 2 tbsp gochujang, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp habanero sauce (or to taste), 1/3 cup water.
In a small cup, mix 2 tsp cornflour with 2 tbsp water (slurry).
Season steak strips with 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp canola oil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Spread on the preheated sheet pan and roast 25–30 minutes, turning once, until deeply golden and crisp.
Start rice: combine rinsed jasmine rice with 2.5 cups water and a pinch of salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and cook 12 minutes. Off heat, rest covered 10 minutes.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil; sear half the steak 60–90 seconds until just browned; transfer. Repeat with remaining steak.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil to the pan. Stir-fry red onion and bell peppers 2 minutes on high. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.

Return steak to the pan with tomatoes. Stir sauce; add to pan and boil 30 seconds. Stir in cornflour slurry and cook 30–60 seconds until glossy and coats ingredients. Adjust heat with more habanero sauce if desired.
Off heat, toss in most of the chopped coriander and spring onion; squeeze half the lime over.
Fluff rice. Serve rice in bowls, top with the gochujang lomo saltado. Add crispy potatoes on the side. Garnish with remaining coriander and spring onion; serve with remaining lime wedges.
